I am having Window ME at home and it has strange thing about the set.  Sometimes I can set it in the command line but not in the
batch file.  And if I set it in command line then the 'set' command in the batch file will be fine.

So I would not count on it.

However, if you don't have long classpath (Window ME has limitation on command lines), you can just use -classpath switch in
javac and java.  Check the tools documentation that comes with your JDK.

Vladimir Bossicard wrote:

> > I'd like to use Junit at home on my WIN95 machine, but
> > I have to rely on the /ext folder because I can't set a CLASSPATH in that
> > environment.
>
> - edit the autoexec.bat file (c:\autoexec.bat)
> - setenv CLASSPATH=c:\progra~1\junit\junit.jar (or 'set' I don't remember)
> - save the file
>
> the 'classpath' is simply an environment variable.
>
> What I used to have in my autoexec.bat:
>
> setenv JDK=[...]\jdk1.2
> setenv JUNIT=[...]\junit
> setenv PROJECT_X=[...]\ProjectX
> setenv CLASSPATH=%JDK%\bin;%JUNIT%\junit.jar;%PROJECT_X%\build
>
> -Vladimir
>
